section.title: Introduction
section.para: One of the view technologies you can use with the Spring Framework is Java Server Pages (JSPs). To help you implement views using Java Server Pages the Spring Framework provides you with some tags for evaluating errors, setting themes and outputting internationalized messages.
Please note that the various tags generated by this form tag library are compliant with the XHTML-1.0-Strict specification and attendant DTD.
This appendix describes the spring-form.tld tag library.

section.title: The checkbox tag
section.para: Renders an HTML 'input' tag with type 'checkbox'.

entry.para: Equivalent to "class" - HTML Optional Attribute. Used when the bound field has errors.
HTML Optional Attribute. Setting the value of this attribute to 'true' (without the quotes) will disable the HTML element.
Enable/disable HTML escaping of rendered values.
Value to be displayed as part of the tag
Path to property for data binding

section.title: The checkboxes tag
section.para: Renders multiple HTML 'input' tags with type 'checkbox'.

entry.para: Equivalent to "class" - HTML Optional Attribute. Used when the bound field has errors.
Delimiter to use between each 'input' tag with type 'checkbox'. There is no delimiter by default.
HTML Optional Attribute. Setting the value of this attribute to 'true' (without the quotes) will disable the HTML element.
Specifies the HTML element that is used to enclose each 'input' tag with type 'checkbox'. Defaults to 'span'.
Enable/disable HTML escaping of rendered values.
Value to be displayed as part of the 'input' tags with type 'checkbox'
The Collection, Map or array of objects used to generate the 'input' tags with type 'checkbox'
Name of the property mapped to 'value' attribute of the 'input' tags with type 'checkbox'
Path to property for data binding

section.title: The errors tag
section.para: Renders field errors in an HTML 'span' tag.

entry.para: Delimiter for displaying multiple error messages. Defaults to the br tag.
Specifies the HTML element that is used to render the enclosing errors.
Enable/disable HTML escaping of rendered values.
Path to errors object for data binding

section.title: The form tag
section.para: Renders an HTML 'form' tag and exposes a binding path to inner tags for binding.

entry.para: Specifies the list of character encodings for input data that is accepted by the server processing this form. The value is a space- and/or comma-delimited list of charset values. The client must interpret this list as an exclusive-or list, i.e., the server is able to accept any single character encoding per entity received.
Name of the model attribute under which the form object is exposed. Defaults to 'command'.
Enable/disable HTML escaping of rendered values.
Name of the model attribute under which the form object is exposed. Defaults to 'command'.
HTML Standard Attribute - added for backwards compatibility cases

section.title: The hidden tag
section.para: Renders an HTML 'input' tag with type 'hidden' using the bound value.

entry.para: Enable/disable HTML escaping of rendered values.
Path to property for data binding

section.title: The input tag
section.para: Renders an HTML 'input' tag with type 'text' using the bound value.

entry.para: Equivalent to "class" - HTML Optional Attribute. Used when the bound field has errors.
HTML Optional Attribute. Setting the value of this attribute to 'true' (without the quotes) will disable the HTML element.
Enable/disable HTML escaping of rendered values.
Path to property for data binding
HTML Optional Attribute. Setting the value of this attribute to 'true' (without the quotes) will make the HTML element readonly.

section.title: The label tag
section.para: Renders a form field label in an HTML 'label' tag.

entry.para: Equivalent to "class" - HTML Optional Attribute. Used only when errors are present.
Enable/disable HTML escaping of rendered values.
Path to errors object for data binding

section.title: The option tag
section.para: Renders a single HTML 'option'. Sets 'selected' as appropriate based on bound value.

entry.para: Equivalent to "class" - HTML Optional Attribute. Used when the bound field has errors.
HTML Optional Attribute. Setting the value of this attribute to 'true' (without the quotes) will disable the HTML element.
Enable/disable HTML escaping of rendered values.

section.title: The options tag
section.para: Renders a list of HTML 'option' tags. Sets 'selected' as appropriate based on bound value.

entry.para: Equivalent to "class" - HTML Optional Attribute. Used when the bound field has errors.
HTML Optional Attribute. Setting the value of this attribute to 'true' (without the quotes) will disable the HTML element.
Enable/disable HTML escaping of rendered values.
Name of the property mapped to the inner text of the 'option' tag
The Collection, Map or array of objects used to generate the inner 'option' tags
Name of the property mapped to 'value' attribute of the 'option' tag

section.title: The password tag
section.para: Renders an HTML 'input' tag with type 'password' using the bound value.

entry.para: Equivalent to "class" - HTML Optional Attribute. Used when the bound field has errors.
HTML Optional Attribute. Setting the value of this attribute to 'true' (without the quotes) will disable the HTML element.
Enable/disable HTML escaping of rendered values.
Path to property for data binding
HTML Optional Attribute. Setting the value of this attribute to 'true' (without the quotes) will make the HTML element readonly.
Is the password value to be shown? Defaults to false.

section.title: The radiobutton tag
section.para: Renders an HTML 'input' tag with type 'radio'.

entry.para: Equivalent to "class" - HTML Optional Attribute. Used when the bound field has errors.
HTML Optional Attribute. Setting the value of this attribute to 'true' (without the quotes) will disable the HTML element.
Enable/disable HTML escaping of rendered values.
Value to be displayed as part of the tag
Path to property for data binding

section.title: The radiobuttons tag
section.para: Renders multiple HTML 'input' tags with type 'radio'.

entry.para: Equivalent to "class" - HTML Optional Attribute. Used when the bound field has errors.
Delimiter to use between each 'input' tag with type 'radio'. There is no delimiter by default.
HTML Optional Attribute. Setting the value of this attribute to 'true' (without the quotes) will disable the HTML element.
Specifies the HTML element that is used to enclose each 'input' tag with type 'radio'. Defaults to 'span'.
Enable/disable HTML escaping of rendered values.
Value to be displayed as part of the 'input' tags with type 'radio'
The Collection, Map or array of objects used to generate the 'input' tags with type 'radio'
Name of the property mapped to 'value' attribute of the 'input' tags with type 'radio'
Path to property for data binding

section.title: The select tag
section.para: Renders an HTML 'select' element. Supports databinding to the selected option.

entry.para: Equivalent to "class" - HTML Optional Attribute. Used when the bound field has errors.
HTML Optional Attribute. Setting the value of this attribute to 'true' (without the quotes) will disable the HTML element.
Enable/disable HTML escaping of rendered values.
Name of the property mapped to the inner text of the 'option' tag
The Collection, Map or array of objects used to generate the inner 'option' tags
Name of the property mapped to 'value' attribute of the 'option' tag
Path to property for data binding
Equivalent to "class" - HTML Optional Attribute. Used when the bound field has errors.
HTML Optional Attribute. Setting the value of this attribute to 'true' (without the quotes) will disable the HTML element.
Enable/disable HTML escaping of rendered values.
Path to property for data binding
HTML Optional Attribute. Setting the value of this attribute to 'true' (without the quotes) will make the HTML element readonly.
